intro: Nothopanax macgillivrayi, commonly known as the MacGillivray's sylph, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal hammocks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
